alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A string of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Grand County through 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms 8 miles southeast of Green River, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall occurring with these storms and may lead to water ponding on I-70 and localized flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Grand County. This includes Interstate 70 in Utah between mile markers 166 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
